subject: Re: [junit] Re: Integrating Jemmy and JUnit
msgSnippet: Depends on the tests, but a lot of them fail as a result of a Jemmy Exception.  I.e. if I am testing that a dialog should be displayed as a result of an
messageBody:
Depends on the tests, but a lot of them fail as a result of a Jemmy Exception. I.e. if I am testing that a dialog should be displayed as a result of an incorrectly entered value.

I enter the value and then invoke the correct button and wait for the dialog. The jemmy code will thrown and exception if it doesnt appear.

try{
JDialogOperator dialog = new JDialogOperator( dialogTitle );
}catch( Exception e ){
fail( "Failed to show dialog" );
}

This is just one case, but similar to many scenerios.

Hope that helps,

Nathan

Johannes Link <john.link@...> wrote:
> > Has anyone tried and succeeded in integrating Jemmy
> > (jemmy.netbeans.org) with JUnit?
>
> I haven't integrated it to the extent you indicate, but I do use Jemmy
> at the API level from JUnit tests.

So how do you determine the success or failure of a Jemmy scenario within a
JUnit test case?

Johannes
